div1.head: Military Orders for Aristides Agramonte, July 16, 1901
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, July 16, 1901.

1. Under the provisions of A. R. 1410, the Subsistence
Department will commute the rations of private Julius Switzer,
troop M, 2d Cavalry, now on duty at Cienfuegos, Cuba,
receiving and delivering meat, from and including July 4,
1901, and while on such duty, at the rate of seventy-five
cents per day, it having been and being impracticable to
provide for his subsistence in any other way.

2. Contract Surgeon A. Agramonte, U. S. Army, is hereby
relieved from the duty enjoined by paragraph 1, Special
Orders No. 117, current series, these Headquarters, at Las
Animas Hospital in this city.

3. Captain Robert H. Rolfe, Quartermaster, U. S. Army,
having reported at these Headquarters, in compliance with
paragraph 23, Special Orders No. 117, current series,
Headquarters of the Army, is assigned to duty as Assistant
to the Chief Quartermaster of the Department and in charge
of construction at Santiago de las Vegas, Cuba.

Captain Rolfe is authorized to make such journeys from
this city to Santiago de las Vegas, and return as may be
necessary to properly discharge his duties.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL WOOD:

H. L. SCOTT,
Captain 7th Cavalry,
Adjutant General.
